qas.question: What film did Richard D. Zanuck and David Brown offer Steven Spielberg to direct?

answers.text: Richard D. Zanuck and David Brown

context: Studio producers <a5_0>Richard D. Zanuck and David Brown<a5_0/> offered Spielberg the director's chair for <a0_0><b14_0>Jaws<b14_0/><a0_0/>, a thriller-horror film based on the <a6_0>Peter Benchley<a6_0/> novel about an enormous killer shark. Spielberg has often referred to the gruelling shoot as his professional crucible. Despite the film's ultimate, enormous success, it was nearly shut down due to <a1_0>delays and budget over-runs<a1_0/>. But Spielberg persevered and finished the film. It was an enormous hit, winning <a2_0><a7_0>three<a7_0/><a2_0/> Academy Awards (for editing, original score and sound) and grossing <a8_0>more than <a3_0><b10_0><b13_0>$470 million<b13_0/><b10_0/> worldwide<a8_0/><a3_0/> at the box office. It also set the domestic record for box office gross, leading to what the press described as "Jawsmania.":248 Jaws made Spielberg a household name and one of America's youngest multi-millionaires, allowing him a great deal of autonomy for his future projects.:250 It was nominated for <a4_0>Best Picture<a4_0/> and featured Spielberg's first of <a9_0><b11_0><b12_0>three<b12_0/><b11_0/><a9_0/> collaborations with actor Richard Dreyfuss.
